problem: An equilateral triangle with side length 6 cm is rotated about its center by 120 degrees. Calculate the area of the region swept out by this rotation.
solution: The radius of the circumscribed circle of the equilateral triangle is $2\sqrt{3}$. After rotating 120 degrees, the swept area is exactly the area of the circumscribed circle. Thus the answer is $\pi \times (2\sqrt{3})^2 = \boxed{12\pi}$.
